member.name: KF_DEFINITION_FLAGS
member.summary: Flags that specify certain known folder behaviors. Used with the structure.

member.name: KF_DEFINITION_FLAGS.KFDF_LOCAL_REDIRECT_ONLY
member.summary: Prevent a known folder from being redirected to a network location. Note that if the known folder has been flagged with KFDF_LOCAL_REDIRECT_ONLY but it is a subfolder of a known folder that is redirected to a network location, this subfolder is redirected also.

member.name: KF_DEFINITION_FLAGS.KFDF_ROAMABLE
member.summary: Can be roamed through a PC-to-PC synchronization.

member.name: KF_DEFINITION_FLAGS.KFDF_PRECREATE
member.summary: Create the folder when the user first logs on. Normally a known folder is not created until it is first called. At that time, an API such as or is called with the flag. However, some known folders need to exist immediately. An example is those known folders under %USERPROFILE%, which must exist to provide a proper view. In those cases, KFDF_PRECREATE is set and Windows Explorer calls the creation API during its user initialization.

member.name: KF_DEFINITION_FLAGS.KFDF_STREAM
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 7. The known folder is a file rather than a folder.

member.name: KF_DEFINITION_FLAGS.KFDF_PUBLISHEXPANDEDPATH
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 7. The full path of the known folder, with any environment variables fully expanded, is stored in the registry under HKEY_CURRENT_USER.

member.name: KF_DEFINITION_FLAGS.KFDF_NO_REDIRECT_UI
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 8.1. Prevent showing the Locations tab in the property dialog of the known folder.
